{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3332438,"name":"Arjan","username":"blanck","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/848f3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T21:49:20.520Z","cooked":"

I am trying to program in (java) LEDs for different states of the robot and haven’t been able to find any good resources on using this non-addressable 12v RGB LED strip ([REV-11-1197] (12V RGB LED Strip - 5m - REV Robotics)) with a rev blinken (REV-11-1105) Does anyone have any good resources I could use?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-13T21:56:22.912Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":83,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":447.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458584,"topic_slug":"how-to-program-12v-rgb-led-strip-with-a-rev-blinken","display_username":"Arjan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1105/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Blinkin LED Driver - REV Robotics","clicks":8},{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1197/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"12V RGB LED Strip - 5m - REV Robotics","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-program-12v-rgb-led-strip-with-a-rev-blinken/458584/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3332446,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T21:58:06.390Z","cooked":"

The Blinken is plugged into one of the Rio’s PWM ports, and then you set it up like a motor such as a Spark. The user manual gives some example values in section 2.4.

Spark blinken = new Spark(5);  // PWM port 5

blinken.set(0.87);  // solid blue, according to user manual
","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-13T21:58:52.601Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":56.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":458584,"topic_slug":"how-to-program-12v-rgb-led-strip-with-a-rev-blinken","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-program-12v-rgb-led-strip-with-a-rev-blinken/458584/2","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332450,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T22:04:43.593Z","cooked":"

There is a set of color codes associated with pwm input to the blinkin documented at docs.revrobotics.com - basically treat it as a pwm motor.

We have one implemented in our codebase on GitHub, I think in the Intake subsystem, if you need an example.

YMMV but we have burnt two blinkins so far this year (Green channel died then whole thing) and I recommend teams to go with the wpilib addressable LED instead.

To turn off the LED do I set it to 0?

We just ripped ours off of our robot. Damn things keep changing voltage all the time for no reason. Its a known problem but REV still sells them knowing there is problems with them.
